page.title: 01Northern Savarn Uplands
page.content: The chief occupation is upland hill sheep farming with store and dairy cattle on the valley floor. Farms tend to be scatteredd, with small population,mainly populated by people working on the area, the farms are generally family farms with the eldest son inheriting the property and remaining siblings finding work elsewhere, outside the area A few professional people live localy and commute to their employment. The land rises steeply from the valley bottom (146m<409m) and in square 1 there is a lake which is used by terns for a breeding area
